item.title: How Coca-Cola tried and failed to suppress a boycott over Gaza
item.dc:creator: John Hudson
item.description: An ad campaign in South Asia tried to distance Coca-Cola from Israel. Instead, it became a case study in misguided corporate messaging.

item.title: Helicopter crashes into Hilton hotel, kills pilot in ‘unauthorized’ flight
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit
item.description: Police in Cairns, in Queensland, Australia, said the flight was “unauthorized” and are investigating. Two guests at the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel were injured.

item.title: The rescue worker and the opera star: Love and fear in wartime Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Kostiantyn Khudov, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: He digs for survivors in the rubble of Russian air strikes, she sings on the basement stage of Kharkiv’s opera house. Together, they work to keep their city alive.

item.title: U.S. deploys missile submarine to Middle East, speeds up aircraft carrier
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: The order came after Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin spoke with Israel’s Defense Minister Yoav Gallant on Sunday, discussing efforts to deter Iran.

item.title: Israeli leaders keep saying the quiet part out loud
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Israel is frequently shielded from censure on the global stage by Western powers whose arguments defending Israel get undercut by Israeli officials themselves.

item.title: Can’t borrow Eiffel Tower, but L.A. 2028 Olympics can learn from Paris 2024
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: L.A. says it knows how to put on a show. But officials were in Paris to watch how the Summer Games played out.

item.title: The risky bets of the Paris Olympics paid off. Who can claim the win?
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: Well before the Closing Ceremonies at the Stade de France on Sunday, the chorus of critics had hushed.

item.title: What to know about Hezbollah weapons as Israel awaits retaliatory strikes
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Samuel Granados
item.description: The Lebanese militant group has guided and unguided rockets, antitank artillery, and ballistic and anti-ship missiles, as well as drones equipped with explosives.

item.title: Hezbollah is undeterred as Lebanon braces for war with Israel
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa
item.description: The militant group has been buoyed by its status as Lebanon’s unrivaled military force, its vast arsenal of weapons and its tens of thousands of men under arms.

item.title: Cartel boss ‘El Mayo’: I was detained before meeting with politician
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: The Sinaloa cartel chief said El Chapo Guzmán’s son invited him to a meeting with Sinaloa’s governor, but he was ambushed and then flown to the United States.

item.title: Amid Venezuela tumult, U.S. wants Latin American countries to lead in finding a solution
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Samantha Schmidt
item.description: The Biden administration has preferred to let leaders of Colombia, Brazil and Mexico take the lead pressuring the Maduro government, but a more active U.S. role may be inevitable.

item.title: Nearly 100 killed in Israeli strike on school, Gaza officials say
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan, Hajar Harb, Mohamad El Chamaa, Adela Suliman, Kelsey Ables
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces said Hamas fighters had been operating in the Gaza City school. Eleven children and six women were among those killed, a Gaza official said.

item.title: The 2024 Paris Olympics, in comics
item.dc:creator: Robyn Smith, Hannah Good, Vidhya Nagarajan, Lisa Hanawalt, Colleen Tighe
item.description: We asked our favorite cartoonists to watch and live illustrate the 2024 Paris Summer Games.

item.title: Ukraine appears to expand Russia incursion, in morale boost for Kyiv
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Anastacia Galouchka
item.description: Ukrainian forces have continued to push deeper into Russia, further signaling this operation wasn’t a short raid but rather a potential occupation.

item.title: Plane carrying 62 people crashes in Brazil with no survivors, official says
item.dc:creator: Marina Dias, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The governor of São Paulo state said he had been informed there were no survivors on Voepass Flight 2283 from Cascavel to São Paulo.
